criteria: Model Accuracy: How accurately does the model represent the relationship between the needs of different plants or animals and their environment?
Identification of Needs: How well does the model identify the specific needs of the plants, animals, or humans?
Representation of Environment: How well does the model represent the key aspects of the environment that relate to the needs of the organisms?
Systems Thinking: How well does the model demonstrate an understanding of the system as a whole, including the interactions between the organisms and their environment?
descriptions: The model is missing or completely irrelevant to the relationship between living things and their environment.
The model attempts to represent the relationship but contains significant inaccuracies or omissions.
The model represents the relationship with several inaccuracies or omissions.
The model generally represents the relationship accurately but may have minor inaccuracies or omissions.
The model represents the relationship accurately with only very minor imperfections.
The model accurately and thoroughly represents the relationship between the needs of different plants or animals and the places they live, demonstrating a strong understanding of the concept.
The model fails to identify any specific needs of the organisms.
The model identifies only one need inaccurately or vaguely.
The model identifies a few needs with limited accuracy or detail.
The model identifies most of the key needs with reasonable accuracy and detail.
The model clearly and accurately identifies nearly all of the key needs.
The model comprehensively and accurately identifies all key needs of the organisms, demonstrating a deep understanding of their requirements for survival.
The model does not represent the environment at all or the representation is completely irrelevant.
The model attempts to represent the environment but is highly inaccurate or incomplete.
The model represents some aspects of the environment, but significant details are missing or incorrect.
The model represents the main aspects of the environment with reasonable accuracy and completeness.
The model represents the environment accurately and includes nearly all relevant details.
The model provides a comprehensive and accurate representation of the environment, including all relevant details and showcasing a strong understanding of environmental factors.
The model shows no understanding of the system as a whole or the interactions between organisms and their environment.
The model hints at a system but fails to demonstrate the interactions of the system.
The model shows a limited understanding of the system, with some of the interactions between the organisms and environment shown.
The model represents the system as a whole, including some of the interactions between organisms and environment.
The model represents the system well, including most of the significant interactions between organisms and environment.
The model represents the system holistically, showing all of the interactions between the organisms and the environment, highlighting their interdependencies.
